title: Faculty and Staff Safety Guidelines - Strategic Communications and Marketing
body: Faculty and Staff Safety Guidelines - Strategic Communications and Marketing Oops! You don't have Javascript enabled. Some features on this site might not work correctly. Kennesaw State University Strategic Communications and Marketing Apply Visit Give Calendar Resources For Current Students Online Only Students Faculty & Staff Parents & Family Alumni & Friends Community & Business MENU About KSU Academics Admissions Student Life Research Alumni Athletics Home Brand Management Creative Services Overview Design Services Photography Services Video Services Licensing Marketing Overview Timing and Workflow KSU Digital Signage Vendor Selection Definitions Social Media Overview Social Media Guidelines Getting Started on Social Best Practices Channels Faculty and Staff Safety Guidelines Community Guidelines Strategic Communications Overview Media Logo Use Project Request Publications Kennesaw State University Magazines Contact Us Staff Members Emails Search KSU Office of Strategic Communications and Marketing / Social Media / Faculty and Staff Safety Guidelines Home Brand Management Creative Services Overview Design Services Photography Services Video Services Licensing Marketing Overview Timing and Workflow KSU Digital Signage Vendor Selection Definitions Social Media Overview Social Media Guidelines Getting Started on Social Best Practices Channels Faculty and Staff Safety Guidelines Community Guidelines Strategic Communications Overview Media Logo Use Project Request Publications Kennesaw State University Magazines Contact Us Staff Members Emails Faculty and Staff Safety Guidelines When identifying as a KSU faculty or staff member on social media, you may be subject to online harassment and other threatening situations. To support University employees, the Office of Strategic Communications and Marketing has compiled a list of best practices to help faculty and staff members on social media prevent and cope with potentially harmful situations.* What is an internet “troll?” According to Merriam-Webster, trolls are typically characterized as online commentors who deliberately post “inflammatory, irrelevant or offensive comments” with the intent to disrupt messaging. What should you do when you encounter a troll or someone who engages in harassment? If you feel you are in immediate danger, call 911 or contact Kennesaw State University Police at 470-578-6666 . KSU’s Office of Strategic Communications and Marketing will be available to offer advice on how to deal with harassment. You can contact the social media team at socialmedia@kennesaw.edu . You should also escalate concerns to your unit’s executive officer. Avoid responding to inflammatory comments. Trolls tend to move on when they don’t have anything to which they can reply. Document as much of the encounter as possible, including messages, emails, social media posts, and voicemails. Take and save screenshots in case you need to file a police report or take legal action. If you are contacted by members of the media during a troll attack, please contact the Office of Strategic Communications and Marketing before responding to inquiries. Other best practices When publishing something that makes you even the slightest bit uncomfortable, discuss it with your supervisor prior to posting. If you have any questions or concerns about a situation unfolding on social media or social media best practices, contact the social media team within the Office of Strategic Communications and Marketing. *Guidelines compiled using best practices shared by universities nationwide. title: Civil and Environmental Engineering FAQs - The Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering
body: Civil and Environmental Engineering FAQs - The Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering Oops! You don't have Javascript enabled. Some features on this site might not work correctly. Kennesaw State University The Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering Apply Visit Give Calendar Resources For Current Students Online Only Students Faculty & Staff Parents & Family Alumni & Friends Community & Business MENU About KSU Academics Admissions Student Life Research Alumni Athletics Home About Overview and Mission Industry Advisory Board Shared Governance Faculty and Staff Accreditation Degrees BS Civil Engineering BS Environmental Engineering Double Owl Pathways MS Civil Engineering Environmental Engineering Minor Interdisciplinary Engineering Ph.D. Transfer Programs Regents’ Engineering Pathway Program Dual Degree Articulations Technical College System of Georgia Course Transfer Search Engine Guide Students Engineering Standing Advising Instructional Labs Resources FAQ Contact Southern Polytechnic College of Engineering and Engineering Technology Search KSU Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering / Students / Civil and Environmental Engineering FAQs Home About Overview and Mission Industry Advisory Board Shared Governance Faculty and Staff Accreditation Degrees BS Civil Engineering BS Environmental Engineering Double Owl Pathways MS Civil Engineering Environmental Engineering Minor Interdisciplinary Engineering Ph.D. Transfer Programs Regents’ Engineering Pathway Program Dual Degree Articulations Technical College System of Georgia Course Transfer Search Engine Guide Students Engineering Standing Advising Instructional Labs Resources FAQ Contact Southern Polytechnic College of Engineering and Engineering Technology Civil and Environmental Engineering FAQs The answers to questions frequently asked by current civil and environmental engineering students can be found below. What is civil engineering? According to the American Society of Civil Engineers, History and Heritage of Civil Engineering , publication, Civil engineering is a professional engineering discipline that deals with the design, construction, and maintenance of the physical and naturally built environment, including works like roads, bridges, canals, dams, and buildings. What is the difference in construction engineering and construction management? The main difference between a construction engineer and a construction manager is licensure. Construction engineers can sit for the Professional Engineer license (PE) but a construction management graduate cannot. In addition, construction managers are not design focused but rather concentrate on construction procedures, methods, and people management. Most will agree that their primary concern is to deliver a project on time, with-in budget, and of the desired quality. What type of careers do Civil Engineers pursue? Civil engineering has five main career specialties: Environmental engineers remove contaminants from water, reduce non-hazardous solid waste volumes, eliminate pollutants from the air and develop groundwater supplies. Geotechnical engineers develop projects below ground and determine ways to support structures on and in the ground. These engineers perfect mixtures for pavements and other structures by developing methods to stabilize soil conditions. Materials engineers develop concrete and pavement systems for construction and soil stabilization methods. Structural engineers face the challenge of designing structures that can withstand gusting winds, extreme temperatures, hurricanes, earthquakes, and other natural forces. They design structures for bridges, buildings, airplanes, and more. Transportation engineers determine ways to meet the increasing travel needs of people, goods, and materials on land, air, and water. What kind of classes does a civil or construction engineering major consist of? Engineering is a discipline that uses calculus to understand physics and other science-related courses which serve as the foundation for the civil and construction engineering curriculum. When these courses are completed, students move into more major specific classes that are related to the five main career specialties in the field. Where is the civil engineering department located? The Civil Engineering Department is located in the Civil and Environmental Engineering Building (L Building). Can I get a Professional Engineers license with a civil engineering degree and a construction engineering degree? Yes. Per the National Society of Professional Engineers, in order to obtain a Professional Engineers license, one must earn a four-year degree in engineering from an accredited engineering program. The Civil, Environmental and Construction Engineering programs are accredited through the Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology at Kennesaw State University. How much do civil engineering graduates earn? Civil engineers earned a median salary of $82,220 in 2015, according to the Bureau of Labor and Statistics. The highest-paid 10 percent in the profession made $129,850, while the lowest-paid earned $52,900 in 2015. Materials for Civil & Construction Engineering Lab The Materials for Civil & Construction Engineering Lab is equipped to evaluate the performance of common construction materials, including concrete and pavement. Strength of Materials Lab The Strength of Materials Lab is equipped to study the performance of laboratory testing and analysis techniques used in the determination of the mechanical behavior of materials under load. Surveying I Lab The Surveying I Lab consists of an assortment of state-of-the-art equipment to gather any topographic information. Transportation Engineering Lab The Transportation Engineering Lab exposes students to a variety of traffic studies commonly conducted in the field. title: Strategic Communications and Public Relations - Strategic Communications and Marketing | KSU
body: Strategic Communications and Public Relations - Strategic Communications and Marketing | KSU Oops! You don't have Javascript enabled. Some features on this site might not work correctly. Kennesaw State University Strategic Communications and Marketing Apply Visit Give Calendar Resources For Current Students Online Only Students Faculty & Staff Parents & Family Alumni & Friends Community & Business MENU About KSU Academics Admissions Student Life Research Alumni Athletics Home Brand Management Creative Services Overview Design Services Photography Services Video Services Licensing Marketing Overview Timing and Workflow KSU Digital Signage Vendor Selection Definitions Social Media Overview Social Media Guidelines Getting Started on Social Best Practices Channels Faculty and Staff Safety Guidelines Community Guidelines Strategic Communications Overview Media Logo Use Project Request Publications Kennesaw State University Magazines Contact Us Staff Members Emails Search KSU Office of Strategic Communications and Marketing / Strategic Communications / Strategic Communications and Public Relations Home Brand Management Creative Services Overview Design Services Photography Services Video Services Licensing Marketing Overview Timing and Workflow KSU Digital Signage Vendor Selection Definitions Social Media Overview Social Media Guidelines Getting Started on Social Best Practices Channels Faculty and Staff Safety Guidelines Community Guidelines Strategic Communications Overview Media Logo Use Project Request Publications Kennesaw State University Magazines Contact Us Staff Members Emails Strategic Communications and Public Relations The Strategic Communications team is responsible for the development and implementation of strategic media relations programs designed to build Kennesaw State’s visibility. In addition to serving as the primary point of contact for the media, the strategic communications team prepares news releases and stories for the University website and proactively develops and maintains effective working relationships with media outlets. Internally, the Strategic Communications team assists in defining the communication needs of the schools and colleges and recommends the most effective means to meet their goals. The Strategic Communications team publishes or administers the following: Campus News Website: This site features the latest announcements from the University and its colleges. It also highlights faculty, campus news and media placements. Kennesaw State University Magazine: The University’s premier publication reports on news, events and research, and highlights other issues related to Kennesaw State. The magazine also profiles prominent alumni, faculty and students. Internal Communications: Strategic Communications and Marketing manages KSU’s internal communications strategy, facilitating the distribution of efficient, clear information to the University’s community of faculty, staff, and students. The University’s internal communications tools and guidelines ensure that KSU team members have the information they need to meet university goals. KSU utilizes multiple tools for disseminating information to campus. KSU Today is a messaging service for faculty and staff; through KSU Today, faculty and staff can post and view messages and subscribe to a daily email digest. KSU Student Inform is a messaging service for students; using KSU Student Inform, faculty and staff can submit posts to be delivered in a daily email digest. Social Media Sites: Kennesaw State uses social media to enhance its existing news and information dissemination, and build an online community of fans and followers to further extend the University brand. Through Facebook, Twitter , Instagram , LinkedIn and other social media outlets, the department shares news and events while encouraging fans and followers to share the information with their friends and followers to spread the word about Kennesaw State University. Kennesaw State Student Merit Pages: We have partnered with Merit Pages to highlight and recognized student accomplishments and achievements. For the Media Our public relations professionals work with specific colleges and departments within the University and are available to assist journalists in obtaining news and contacting faculty. For help identifying faculty experts, please contact our public relations staff. Information for the media: Press Releases Faculty Experts About KSU Office of the President Open Records Requests Media Relations Contacts For Faculty and Staff Looking to spread the word about breakthrough research, upcoming events, a special class or project, or your expertise on a timely topic? Dedicated public relations professionals within strategic communications can work with you to determine the best way to promote your news. Click here for the public relations staff directory. title: Community Guidelines - Strategic Communications and Marketing
body: Community Guidelines - Strategic Communications and Marketing Oops! You don't have Javascript enabled. Some features on this site might not work correctly. Kennesaw State University Strategic Communications and Marketing Apply Visit Give Calendar Resources For Current Students Online Only Students Faculty & Staff Parents & Family Alumni & Friends Community & Business MENU About KSU Academics Admissions Student Life Research Alumni Athletics Home Brand Management Creative Services Overview Design Services Photography Services Video Services Licensing Marketing Overview Timing and Workflow KSU Digital Signage Vendor Selection Definitions Social Media Overview Social Media Guidelines Getting Started on Social Best Practices Channels Faculty and Staff Safety Guidelines Community Guidelines Strategic Communications Overview Media Logo Use Project Request Publications Kennesaw State University Magazines Contact Us Staff Members Emails Search KSU Office of Strategic Communications and Marketing / Social Media / Community Guidelines Home Brand Management Creative Services Overview Design Services Photography Services Video Services Licensing Marketing Overview Timing and Workflow KSU Digital Signage Vendor Selection Definitions Social Media Overview Social Media Guidelines Getting Started on Social Best Practices Channels Faculty and Staff Safety Guidelines Community Guidelines Strategic Communications Overview Media Logo Use Project Request Publications Kennesaw State University Magazines Contact Us Staff Members Emails Community Guidelines Kennesaw State University values open, honest, and thoughtful intellectual inquiry, professionalism, collaboration, integrity and ethical behavior, engaged citizenship, global understanding, mutual respect, and appreciation of human and cultural diversity. These principles apply to every aspect of our community, whether on campus or online. We welcome all opinions and encourage open discussion about the topics we post to our social media platforms. There may be social media comments posted to our pages that you or others do not agree with; those posts will remain visible in order to maintain transparency and promote constructive dialogue. However, KSU prides itself on offering a welcoming and inclusive environment and does not condone intolerant behaviors that suggest otherwise. Therefore, the university retains discretion to allow or disallow comments and/or posts for the safety, security and well-being of our community. Posts and/or comments may be removed for any of the following reasons: The use of vulgar, derogatory, discriminatory, harassing or threatening language or obscene content Illegal activity Disclosure of information that is confidential by law or regulation Violations of intellectual property, copyrights or trademarks Advertisements or solicitations from external parties Endorsements or opposition of any person campaigning for election to a political office or promoting or opposing any ballet proposal Comments that are off-topic or irrelevant to the KSU community Duplicate comments by the same user or multiple users. In the case of identical comments, only the initial submission will be approved. While KSU regularly monitors its social media accounts, we encourage all users to report posts or comments that violate our community standards. title: Civil and Environmental Engineering Scholarships - The Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering
body: Civil and Environmental Engineering Scholarships - The Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering Oops! You don't have Javascript enabled. Some features on this site might not work correctly. Kennesaw State University The Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering Apply Visit Give Calendar Resources For Current Students Online Only Students Faculty & Staff Parents & Family Alumni & Friends Community & Business MENU About KSU Academics Admissions Student Life Research Alumni Athletics Home About Overview and Mission Industry Advisory Board Shared Governance Faculty and Staff Accreditation Degrees BS Civil Engineering BS Environmental Engineering Double Owl Pathways MS Civil Engineering Environmental Engineering Minor Interdisciplinary Engineering Ph.D. Transfer Programs Regents’ Engineering Pathway Program Dual Degree Articulations Technical College System of Georgia Course Transfer Search Engine Guide Students Engineering Standing Advising Instructional Labs Resources FAQ Contact Southern Polytechnic College of Engineering and Engineering Technology Search KSU Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering / Students / Civil and Environmental Engineering Scholarships Home About Overview and Mission Industry Advisory Board Shared Governance Faculty and Staff Accreditation Degrees BS Civil Engineering BS Environmental Engineering Double Owl Pathways MS Civil Engineering Environmental Engineering Minor Interdisciplinary Engineering Ph.D. Transfer Programs Regents’ Engineering Pathway Program Dual Degree Articulations Technical College System of Georgia Course Transfer Search Engine Guide Students Engineering Standing Advising Instructional Labs Resources FAQ Contact Southern Polytechnic College of Engineering and Engineering Technology Civil and Environmental Engineering Scholarships All engineering majors, in good standing, are eligible to apply for available scholarships. Each scholarship awarded is based on available funds. Awarded recipient will have funds placed in their student account – to be applied toward tuition and/or fees. Interested students are encouraged to complete the application process through the online KSU Scholarship application at the Office of Scholarships . The online scholarship application opens up on November 1st and closes on March 15th. Scholarships Available GeoSurvey Scholarship For full-time students pursuing a BS in Surveying and Mapping with a minimum GPA of 3.0. Given by Trent Turk, BS 1986 and GeoSurvey, Ltd Harold and Linda Linnenkohl Scholarship Benefits a full-time student who is a Georgia resident. Pursuing a BS in Civil Engineering. Given by Harold (AS 1968) and Linda Linnenkohl Ellen and Shepherd Long Scholarship Ellen and Shepherd Long Endowed Scholarship will provide assistance to a gender underrepresented in the Civil Engineering Program. Student must be a undergraduate enrolled full time with a minimum GPA of 3.0 majoring in civil engineering. Need based as determined by the Office of Financial Aid. Given by Ellen and Shepherd Long, Long Engineering, Atlanta, GA. Reza Abree Endowed Scholarship Etablished by Reza Abree, to benefit a full-time undergraduate student who holds a minimum 3.0 GPA. This scholarship is available to students majoring in Civil Engineering, Construction Engineering, Environmental Engineering, or Construction Management, with preference given to Civil Engineering majors. Given by Reza Abree, BS 1978, Civil Engineering Technology Stability Engineering Endowed Scholarship Benefits a junior or senior student, majoring in Civil or Construction Engineering with an interest/focus on Structural Engineering. Given by Pierre Coiron, BS 1995 CET, BS 2014 Construction Engineering and Stability Engineering Contact Info Kennesaw Campus 1000 Chastain Road Kennesaw, GA 30144 Marietta Campus 1100 South Marietta Pkwy Marietta, GA 30060 Campus Maps Phone 470-KSU-INFO (470-578-4636) kennesaw.edu/info Media Resources Resources For Current Students Online Only Students Faculty & Staff Parents & Family Alumni & Friends Community & Business Related Links Libraries Housing Financial Aid Degrees, Majors & Programs Registrar Job Opportunities Campus Security Global Education Diverse & Inclusive Excellence Sustainability Accessibility Follow KSU 470-KSU-INFO (470-578-4636) © 2022 Kennesaw State University. An internship experience also fosters the development of new skills and provides valuable insight into the practice of engineering. Internships enhance your resume and give you an edge in the job market. Many companies use internships as a recruiting tool for permanent employment. In order to receive three hours of elective credit (CE 3398) in an engineering program, SPCEET students must apply for approval of a proposed engineering internship. Applications for internships may be made through Handshake . title: Visual Identity Program
body: Visual Identity Program Oops! You don't have Javascript enabled. Some features on this site might not work correctly. Kennesaw State University Visual Identity Program Apply Visit Give Calendar Resources For Current Students Online Only Students Faculty & Staff Parents & Family Alumni & Friends Community & Business MENU About KSU Academics Admissions Student Life Research Alumni Athletics Home Using This Guide Using This Guide About Our Name Terminology Official Logo Guidelines Official Logo Guidelines Logo Usage VIP Logos, Marks and Seal Official Primary Colors Typography Unacceptable Variations Stationery Logo Request Email Signature Athletics Style Guide Facilities Branding Guide Other Uses Other Uses Signage Environmental Design Website Design Design Approval Advertising Approval Form Licensing Downloads Office of Strategic Communications and Marketing Search KSU The Brand Home Using This Guide Using This Guide About Our Name Terminology Official Logo Guidelines Official Logo Guidelines Logo Usage VIP Logos, Marks and Seal Official Primary Colors Typography Unacceptable Variations Stationery Logo Request Email Signature Athletics Style Guide Facilities Branding Guide Other Uses Other Uses Signage Environmental Design Website Design Design Approval Advertising Approval Form Licensing Downloads Office of Strategic Communications and Marketing The Brand When some people hear the word “brand” they think “logo” — a signature typeface, a captivating color scheme, a clever mark. But a brand can be – and should – be much, much more. A strong brand is the expression of everything we do, say and deliver. It’s a unifying identity that distills our spirit and serves as a powerful visual reminder of our mission. It has reflections of who we are and points to the promise of what we can become. At KSU we believe in the power of our brand. It’s the articulation of our student-centered focus and our commitment to explore, collaborate and unite a diverse spectrum of backgrounds and talents. It represents openness, challenge and opportunity. It channels the spirit of what it means to be Owls, and it lights the path so that together we all ascend to new heights. The linked KSU Brand Guidebook outlines the core components and key tools that power our brand, providing guidance on how to apply our brand elements across a range of audiences, channels and creative elements. Our brand elements are built to work in harmony, helping brand communicators and ambassadors bring our brand to life each and every day. These stewards of the KSU brand have a responsibility – a duty to help deliver that brand essence with consistency and power. The linked guide below delivers the foundations and tools to make that possible. title: Tax-Free Retirement and Long Term Care – Community and Professional Education
body: Tax-Free Retirement and Long Term Care – Community and Professional Education Courses Professional Certificates & Courses Corporate Learning Online Courses Executive Education 50+ OLLI Program Personal Enrichment Classes Summer Camps Intensive English Program Our Community Catalog Events Open House Webinars Graduation Book an Event Student Resources Career Development Resources Catalog Financial Aid Frequently Asked Questions KSU Discounts Military Education Benefits Scholarships About About Us Blog Contact Instructor Application Give to CPE Login Login to Register Login to Moodle Search for: Courses Professional Certificates & Courses Corporate Learning Online Courses Executive Education 50+ OLLI Program Personal Enrichment Classes Summer Camps Intensive English Program Our Community Catalog Events Open House Webinars Graduation Book an Event Student Resources Career Development Resources Catalog Financial Aid Frequently Asked Questions KSU Discounts Military Education Benefits Scholarships About About Us Blog Contact Instructor Application Give to CPE Login Login to Register Login to Moodle Search for: 50+ OLLI Home All courses 50+ OLLI Tax-Free Retirement and Long Term Care Tax-Free Retirement and Long Term Care Personal Finance $69 More Info & Contact Enroll Now Share: Overview Offerings & Schedules Instructor Financial Aid In an easy-to-understand format, the instructor teaches students Tax-Free and Tax-Advantaged Strategies for middle America. This class is designed for retirees and pre-retirees with retirement accounts like 401k’s and IRA’s that believe taxes will be higher in the future. Additionally, the instructor will give information on the basics of Traditional Long-Term Care and Alternative Long Term Care Strategies. Tax-Free strategies for Retirement Income Tax Diversification Planning-THE TAX MATRIX ROTH IRA rules and strategies-What you need to know for Retirement Using Charitable Trusts for Retirement Income and Charitable Benefits Traditional Long-Term Care What is the Georgia Partnership Plan Alternative Long Term Care strategies Nicholas Yeomans Nic Yeomans is the President and Chief Compliance Officer at Yeomans Consulting Group, Inc. In his 16th year of practice, Nic is a Certified Financial Planner where he primarily focuses on advanced tax and estate planning for business owners, medical professionals, and retirees. Nic has a passion to educate his clients and peers, often teaching classes and hosting Q&A sessions. Nic graduated from Lee University and continued his education at Emory University where he graduated from The Learning Institute for Financial Executives and received his Certificate in Financial Planning. He is also a member of the International Association of Registered Financial Consultants. Outside of work, Nic has been married to his college sweetheart Suzette for 15 years; together they have 3 daughters and 2 dogs. They are active members at North Metro Church in Marietta, and in their free time, they enjoy traveling and discovering new restaurants. A few times a month you will find Nic on the golf course or hosting a guy’s night to watch UFC fights. #1: Tax-Free Retirement and Long Term Care Start/End: 10/04/2022 to 10/06/2022 Fee: $69 Delivery: Classroom Location: KSU Center Class ID 40345 Start Date October 04, 2022 End Date October 06, 2022 Delivery Classroom Location KSU Center Sessions 2 Weeks 1 Total Hours 5.0 CEUs 0.0 Classes Schedule: Session Date Time Location Delivery Instructor 01 Tuesday, 10/04/2022 09:30 AM - 12:00 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Nicholas Yeomans 02 Thursday, 10/06/2022 09:30 AM - 12:00 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Nicholas Yeomans ENROLL IN THIS OFFERING #2: Tax-Free Retirement and Long Term Care Online Live Start/End: 10/04/2022 to 10/06/2022 Fee: $69 Delivery: Online Location: n/a Class ID 40346 Start Date October 04, 2022 End Date October 06, 2022 Delivery Online Location n/a Total Hours 5.0 CEUs 0.0 Classes Schedule: Session Date Time Location Delivery Instructor 01 Tuesday, 10/04/2022 09:30 AM - 12:00 PM n/a Online Nicholas Yeomans 02 Thursday, 10/06/2022 09:30 AM - 12:00 PM n/a Online Nicholas Yeomans ENROLL IN THIS OFFERING Financial Aid Options No options available at this moment. body: Selling on the Internet – Community and Professional Education Courses Professional Certificates & Courses Corporate Learning Online Courses Executive Education 50+ OLLI Program Personal Enrichment Classes Summer Camps Intensive English Program Our Community Catalog Events Open House Webinars Graduation Book an Event Student Resources Career Development Resources Catalog Financial Aid Frequently Asked Questions KSU Discounts Military Education Benefits Scholarships About About Us Blog Contact Instructor Application Give to CPE Login Login to Register Login to Moodle Search for: Courses Professional Certificates & Courses Corporate Learning Online Courses Executive Education 50+ OLLI Program Personal Enrichment Classes Summer Camps Intensive English Program Our Community Catalog Events Open House Webinars Graduation Book an Event Student Resources Career Development Resources Catalog Financial Aid Frequently Asked Questions KSU Discounts Military Education Benefits Scholarships About About Us Blog Contact Instructor Application Give to CPE Login Login to Register Login to Moodle Search for: 50+ OLLI Home All courses 50+ OLLI Selling on the Internet Selling on the Internet Technology & Computers $119 More Info & Contact Enroll Now Share: Overview Offerings & Schedules Instructor Financial Aid This course is designed for those with a desire to learn how to sell on the internet. This class will introduce students to topics such as: how to get started, what options are available for a quick start up, proven methods for fast entrance into the world of ecommerce, and the utilization of various platforms. James Daniel James is a retired Telecommunications Executive with over 25 years in the industry. He is also a member of the Society of Certified Senior Advisors. Since retirement he has been an active professional seller on both the eBay and Amazon ecommerce platforms for the past 13 years. He is an eBay Education Specialist, trained by eBay and an eBay PowerSeller. He also maintains his own ecommerce websites and a Blog. He has been consulting with and training both individuals and businesses on the processes of selling on eBay since 2003. In his capacity as an eBay Education Specialist he has appeared on local TV, in local newspapers, and in a national publication. #1: Selling on the Internet Start/End: 10/08/2022 to 10/08/2022 Fee: $119 Delivery: Classroom Location: KSU Center Class ID 40283 Start Date October 08, 2022 End Date October 08, 2022 Delivery Classroom Location KSU Center Sessions 1 Weeks 1 Total Hours 6.0 CEUs 0.0 Classes Schedule: Session Date Time Location Delivery Instructor 01 Saturday, 10/08/2022 09:00 AM - 03:30 PM KSU Center ClassRoom James Daniel ENROLL IN THIS OFFERING Financial Aid Options No options available at this moment. Students will learn how to: make columns of information, manipulate large amounts of data, insert basic formulas, use auto format and auto fill, and create a presentable spreadsheet. Additionally, students can learn how to make a graph from their data. Natalie Silver Originally from Dallas Texas, Natalie Silver moved to Atlanta after graduate school to begin her own training and consulting business. For over 20 years, Natalie has instructed people of all ages on all types of software. Natalie’s specialty is advanced skills in Microsoft Access and Excel, but she is also well versed in Peachtree and Quickbooks accounting software applications. #1: Beginning Basics of Microsoft Excel Start/End: 09/13/2022 to 09/15/2022 Fee: $199 Delivery: Classroom Location: KSU Center Class ID 39827 Start Date September 13, 2022 End Date September 15, 2022 Delivery Classroom Location KSU Center Sessions 2 Weeks 1 Total Hours 10.0 CEUs 0.0 Classes Schedule: Session Date Time Location Delivery Instructor 01 Tuesday, 09/13/2022 09:00 AM - title: Read Your U.S. Constitution – Community and Professional Education
body: Read Your U.S. Constitution – Community and Professional Education Courses Professional Certificates & Courses Corporate Learning Online Courses Executive Education 50+ OLLI Program Personal Enrichment Classes Summer Camps Intensive English Program Our Community Catalog Events Open House Webinars Graduation Book an Event Student Resources Career Development Resources Catalog Financial Aid Frequently Asked Questions KSU Discounts Military Education Benefits Scholarships About About Us Blog Contact Instructor Application Give to CPE Login Login to Register Login to Moodle Search for: Courses Professional Certificates & Courses Corporate Learning Online Courses Executive Education 50+ OLLI Program Personal Enrichment Classes Summer Camps Intensive English Program Our Community Catalog Events Open House Webinars Graduation Book an Event Student Resources Career Development Resources Catalog Financial Aid Frequently Asked Questions KSU Discounts Military Education Benefits Scholarships About About Us Blog Contact Instructor Application Give to CPE Login Login to Register Login to Moodle Search for: 50+ OLLI Home All courses 50+ OLLI Read Your U.S. Constitution Read Your U.S. Constitution History $69 More Info & Contact Enroll Now Share: Overview Offerings & Schedules Instructor Financial Aid This course is a survey of the U.S. Constitution and is not political. Understanding the three branches of government and the amendment process is invaluable to all Americans. The perspectives and personalities of the founders will make the Constitution come alive. The debates and compromises that resulted in the oldest standing written Constitution in the history of the world will be highlighted. As we approach our 250th anniversary understanding the original intent will be invaluable to all Americans. Quentin Thomas Quentin Thomas is a respected historian, author, and instructor. His passion is American history with an emphasis on the early Western United States. As a retired senior military officer he brings a unique historical perspective to palaces where he has often visited and studied in great detail. His classes have been enthusiastically attended by hundreds of students at numerous locations and events. #1: Read Your U.S. Constitution Start/End: 09/21/2022 to 11/09/2022 Fee: $69 Delivery: Classroom Location: KSU Center Class ID 40314 Start Date September 21, 2022 End Date November 09, 2022 Delivery Classroom Location KSU Center Sessions 8 Weeks 8 Total Hours 8.0 CEUs 0.0 Classes Schedule: Session Date Time Location Delivery Instructor 01 Wednesday, 09/21/2022 09:30 AM - 10:30 AM KSU Center ClassRoom Quentin Thomas 02 Wednesday, 09/28/2022 09:30 AM - 10:30 AM KSU Center ClassRoom Quentin Thomas 03 Wednesday, 10/05/2022 09:30 AM - 10:30 AM KSU Center ClassRoom Quentin Thomas 04 Wednesday, 10/12/2022 09:30 AM - 10:30 AM KSU Center ClassRoom Quentin Thomas 05 Wednesday, 10/19/2022 09:30 AM - 10:30 AM KSU Center ClassRoom Quentin Thomas 06 Wednesday, 10/26/2022 09:30 AM - 10:30 AM KSU Center ClassRoom Quentin Thomas 07 Wednesday, 11/02/2022 09:30 AM - 10:30 AM KSU Center ClassRoom Quentin Thomas 08 Wednesday, 11/09/2022 09:30 AM - 10:30 AM KSU Center ClassRoom Quentin Thomas ENROLL IN THIS OFFERING Financial Aid Options No options available at this moment. title: Photo I - Introduction to Photography – Community and Professional Education
body: Photo I - Introduction to Photography – Community and Professional Education Courses Professional Certificates & Courses Corporate Learning Online Courses Executive Education 50+ OLLI Program Personal Enrichment Classes Summer Camps Intensive English Program Our Community Catalog Events Open House Webinars Graduation Book an Event Student Resources Career Development Resources Catalog Financial Aid Frequently Asked Questions KSU Discounts Military Education Benefits Scholarships About About Us Blog Contact Instructor Application Give to CPE Login Login to Register Login to Moodle Search for: Courses Professional Certificates & Courses Corporate Learning Online Courses Executive Education 50+ OLLI Program Personal Enrichment Classes Summer Camps Intensive English Program Our Community Catalog Events Open House Webinars Graduation Book an Event Student Resources Career Development Resources Catalog Financial Aid Frequently Asked Questions KSU Discounts Military Education Benefits Scholarships About About Us Blog Contact Instructor Application Give to CPE Login Login to Register Login to Moodle Search for: 50+ OLLI Home All courses 50+ OLLI Photo I – Introduction to Photography Photo I – Introduction to Photography Photography $179 More Info & Contact Enroll Now Share: Overview Offerings & Schedules Instructor Financial Aid If you have ever looked at a photo and thought, ‘I wish I could take pictures like that!’ Then this course is your first step. Dive into the world of photography and learn with us how to operate and care for a camera. De-mystify what f/stops, aperture, and shutter speed mean. Learn the basics of composition and how to use depth of focus to your advantage. Join us and submerge yourself into the world of light. Start taking the kind of photos that you want. Bring a camera with a manual mode if you have one (digital or film). Martin Longstaff Martin Longstaff is a photographer and graphic artist based in North Georgia, USA. Originally from the Highlands of Scotland, Martin has lived, worked and photographed in many corners of the world. This includes being country representative in SE Asia for a company with the sole distribution rights to Nikon and Hasselblad cameras. It also includes owning a large format printing business in San Diego, CA. Martin now runs Thom Creative with clients on both sides of the US. The photographic side of this business concentrates mainly on Landscape and Travel. Examples of his work can be found at ThomPhotography.com and on Instagram (@Thom_Photog). #1: Photo I - Introduction to Photography Start/End: 10/04/2022 to 11/08/2022 Fee: $179 Delivery: Classroom Location: KSU Center Class ID 40352 Start Date October 04, 2022 End Date November 08, 2022 Delivery Classroom Location KSU Center Sessions 6 Weeks 6 Total Hours 12.0 CEUs 0.0 Classes Schedule: Session Date Time Location Delivery Instructor 01 Tuesday, 10/04/2022 06:30 PM - 08:30 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Martin Longstaff 02 Tuesday, 10/11/2022 06:30 PM - 08:30 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Martin Longstaff 03 Tuesday, 10/18/2022 06:30 PM - 08:30 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Martin Longstaff 04 Tuesday, 10/25/2022 06:30 PM - 08:30 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Martin Longstaff 05 Tuesday, 11/01/2022 06:30 PM - 08:30 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Martin Longstaff 06 Tuesday, 11/08/2022 06:30 PM - 08:30 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Martin Longstaff ENROLL IN THIS OFFERING Financial Aid Options No options available at this moment. If you have already taken the previous classes or if you have already been exposed to the italian language, this is the class for you. Be ready to speak more in Italian and to deepen your knowledge. we will continue talking about the culture and traditions of Italy in a fun way. Ci vediamo!. If you are not sure of your level of fluency, please contact the office to schedule a time to be evaluated by the instructor. Antonella Giannasca Antonella was born in Rome, Italy and moved to the United States 16 years ago. This is her 13th year teaching Italian. She often travels back to Italy to visit family. Antonella’s favorite memory is a nice Italian cappuccino with her favorite “cornetto!” She recently completed a TESOL Certificate and looks forward to teaching English to native Italian speakers. #1: Introduction to Italian IV Start/End: 01/23/2023 to 03/27/2023 Fee: $159 Delivery: Classroom Location: KSU Center Class ID 40524 Start Date January 23, 2023 End Date March 27, 2023 Delivery Classroom Location KSU Center Sessions 10 Weeks 10 Total Hours 20.0 CEUs 0.0 Classes Schedule: Session Date Time Location Delivery Instructor 01 Monday, 01/23/2023 10:00 AM - Students will learn more Italian expressions and verbs, as well as how to conversate effectively in the Italian language. Students should be prepared to speak more in class If you are not sure of your level of fluency, please contact the office to schedule a time to be evaulated by the instructor. Antonella Giannasca Antonella was born in Rome, Italy and moved to the United States 16 years ago. This is her 13th year teaching Italian. She often travels back to Italy to visit family. Antonella’s favorite memory is a nice Italian cappuccino with her favorite “cornetto!” She recently completed a TESOL Certificate and looks forward to teaching English to native Italian speakers. #1: Introduction to Italian III Start/End: 10/03/2022 to 12/05/2022 Fee: $159 Delivery: Classroom Location: KSU Center Class ID 40271 Start Date October 03, 2022 End Date December 05, 2022 Delivery Classroom Location KSU Center Sessions 10 Weeks 10 Total Hours 20.0 CEUs 0.0 Classes Schedule: Session Date Time Location Delivery Instructor 01 Monday, 10/03/2022 10:00 AM - Bravi! This course is designed to introduce students to the Italian language. Students will learn how to express themselves with basic sentences, using verb conjugation and everyday vocabulary. This will be a fun and active course that will allow learners to acquire basic Italian language skills. Italian NOW is a required book for this class. This can be purchased at the KSU bookstore. Please call 470-578-2342 for the price and hours of the bookstore. Antonella Giannasca Antonella was born in Rome, Italy and moved to the United States 16 years ago. This is her 13th year teaching Italian. She often travels back to Italy to visit family. title: Introduction to French II Online – Community and Professional Education
body: Introduction to French II Online – Community and Professional Education Courses Professional Certificates & Courses Corporate Learning Online Courses Executive Education 50+ OLLI Program Personal Enrichment Classes Summer Camps Intensive English Program Our Community Catalog Events Open House Webinars Graduation Book an Event Student Resources Career Development Resources Catalog Financial Aid Frequently Asked Questions KSU Discounts Military Education Benefits Scholarships About About Us Blog Contact Instructor Application Give to CPE Login Login to Register Login to Moodle Search for: Courses Professional Certificates & Courses Corporate Learning Online Courses Executive Education 50+ OLLI Program Personal Enrichment Classes Summer Camps Intensive English Program Our Community Catalog Events Open House Webinars Graduation Book an Event Student Resources Career Development Resources Catalog Financial Aid Frequently Asked Questions KSU Discounts Military Education Benefits Scholarships About About Us Blog Contact Instructor Application Give to CPE Login Login to Register Login to Moodle Search for: 50+ OLLI Home All courses 50+ OLLI Introduction to French II Online Introduction to French II Online Online Online-Live Languages & Writing $159 More Info & Contact Enroll Now Share: Overview Offerings & Schedules Instructor Financial Aid Bonjour! Join us in this next French class as we go out to dine and shop for clothes. We will also learn vocabulary for a market visit and look at some typical recipes. Let’s visit Paris and her monuments and hidden gems. This course requires Introduction to French I as a prerequisite or at least some knowledge of the basics in French. See you soon! A bientôt! Special notice: This class will be delivered online. You will need access to a computer with an internet connection that remains stable for the duration of the class. Though a chat feature is available, a microphone is preferred. For most productive audio/video participation, a webcam and/or headset are encouraged. Virtual classes may be recorded. Danielle Vincelli McRae French-Canadian born Danielle Vincelli has been teaching as long as she can remember. Her sisters were her first pretend students and then her friends. She taught crafts, languages and swimming before going to college where she studied languages and translation first then teaching, to no one’s surprise. After graduating from Concordia University and McGill University in Montreal, Canada, Danielle taught in a French speaking elementary school for 8 years until her husband’s job moved them to the US. While she stayed home with her boys, she tutored many kids and adults in French and Spanish. Recently, she taught French in her local middle school and high school. She is now excited to share her love for French culture and language with adults. #1: Introduction to French II Online Start/End: 10/05/2022 to 12/14/2022 Fee: $159 Delivery: Online Location: n/a Class ID 40349 Start Date October 05, 2022 End Date December 14, 2022 Delivery Online Location n/a Total Hours 20.0 CEUs 0.0 Classes Schedule: Session Date Time Location Delivery Instructor 01 Wednesday, 10/05/2022 10:00 AM - title: Photo II - Photography as Art – Community and Professional Education
body: Photo II - Photography as Art – Community and Professional Education Courses Professional Certificates & Courses Corporate Learning Online Courses Executive Education 50+ OLLI Program Personal Enrichment Classes Summer Camps Intensive English Program Our Community Catalog Events Open House Webinars Graduation Book an Event Student Resources Career Development Resources Catalog Financial Aid Frequently Asked Questions KSU Discounts Military Education Benefits Scholarships About About Us Blog Contact Instructor Application Give to CPE Login Login to Register Login to Moodle Search for: Courses Professional Certificates & Courses Corporate Learning Online Courses Executive Education 50+ OLLI Program Personal Enrichment Classes Summer Camps Intensive English Program Our Community Catalog Events Open House Webinars Graduation Book an Event Student Resources Career Development Resources Catalog Financial Aid Frequently Asked Questions KSU Discounts Military Education Benefits Scholarships About About Us Blog Contact Instructor Application Give to CPE Login Login to Register Login to Moodle Search for: 50+ OLLI Home All courses 50+ OLLI Photo II – Photography as Art Photo II – Photography as Art Photography $179 More Info & Contact Enroll Now Share: Overview Offerings & Schedules Instructor Financial Aid In this course, we continue our journey of learning and move well beyond the basic functions and care of your camera. We take an exciting journey into the world of photography as art and the development of your artistic eye. We talk in depth about composition and find out how to control and use light and shadow. We create art from common objects, learn about portraiture and group arrangement, spend a whole session on photo editing and learn about how to succeed in photo competitions. Come join us and learn how to create art with your photography. Martin Longstaff Martin Longstaff is a photographer and graphic artist based in North Georgia, USA. Originally from the Highlands of Scotland, Martin has lived, worked and photographed in many corners of the world. This includes being country representative in SE Asia for a company with the sole distribution rights to Nikon and Hasselblad cameras. It also includes owning a large format printing business in San Diego, CA. Martin now runs Thom Creative with clients on both sides of the US. The photographic side of this business concentrates mainly on Landscape and Travel. Examples of his work can be found at ThomPhotography.com and on Instagram (@Thom_Photog). #1: Photo II - Photography as Art Start/End: 10/04/2022 to 11/08/2022 Fee: $179 Delivery: Classroom Location: KSU Center Class ID 40353 Start Date October 04, 2022 End Date November 08, 2022 Delivery Classroom Location KSU Center Sessions 6 Weeks 6 Total Hours 12.0 CEUs 0.0 Classes Schedule: Session Date Time Location Delivery Instructor 01 Tuesday, 10/04/2022 04:00 PM - 06:00 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Martin Longstaff 02 Tuesday, 10/11/2022 04:00 PM - 06:00 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Martin Longstaff 03 Tuesday, 10/18/2022 04:00 PM - 06:00 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Martin Longstaff 04 Tuesday, 10/25/2022 04:00 PM - 06:00 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Martin Longstaff 05 Tuesday, 11/01/2022 04:00 PM - 06:00 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Martin Longstaff 06 Tuesday, 11/08/2022 04:00 PM - 06:00 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Martin Longstaff ENROLL IN THIS OFFERING Financial Aid Options No options available at this moment. body: Our Brush With History – Community and Professional Education Courses Professional Certificates & Courses Corporate Learning Online Courses Executive Education 50+ OLLI Program Personal Enrichment Classes Summer Camps Intensive English Program Our Community Catalog Events Open House Webinars Graduation Book an Event Student Resources Career Development Resources Catalog Financial Aid Frequently Asked Questions KSU Discounts Military Education Benefits Scholarships About About Us Blog Contact Instructor Application Give to CPE Login Login to Register Login to Moodle Search for: Courses Professional Certificates & Courses Corporate Learning Online Courses Executive Education 50+ OLLI Program Personal Enrichment Classes Summer Camps Intensive English Program Our Community Catalog Events Open House Webinars Graduation Book an Event Student Resources Career Development Resources Catalog Financial Aid Frequently Asked Questions KSU Discounts Military Education Benefits Scholarships About About Us Blog Contact Instructor Application Give to CPE Login Login to Register Login to Moodle Search for: 50+ OLLI Home All courses 50+ OLLI Our Brush With History Our Brush With History History $59 More Info & Contact Enroll Now Share: Overview Offerings & Schedules Instructor Financial Aid Where were you when President Kennedy was shot? When Iran seized our embassy in Tehran? This course will explore events in American history during the last 70 years. We’ll look at the following topics: JFK’s presidency and assassination, including possible assassination theories; the student revolt and the counterculture of the sixties; the Vietnam War, what went right, what went wrong, and the question of could the U.S. have won; Nixon’s détente with China and Russia, the end of the Cold War, and new threats from both nations; the Iranian Revolution, the hostage crisis, and the Iranian threat today; the events leading to 9/11 & where the U.S. seems to be in the war on terror. title: Mah Jongg – Community and Professional Education
body: Mah Jongg – Community and Professional Education Courses Professional Certificates & Courses Corporate Learning Online Courses Executive Education 50+ OLLI Program Personal Enrichment Classes Summer Camps Intensive English Program Our Community Catalog Events Open House Webinars Graduation Book an Event Student Resources Career Development Resources Catalog Financial Aid Frequently Asked Questions KSU Discounts Military Education Benefits Scholarships About About Us Blog Contact Instructor Application Give to CPE Login Login to Register Login to Moodle Search for: Courses Professional Certificates & Courses Corporate Learning Online Courses Executive Education 50+ OLLI Program Personal Enrichment Classes Summer Camps Intensive English Program Our Community Catalog Events Open House Webinars Graduation Book an Event Student Resources Career Development Resources Catalog Financial Aid Frequently Asked Questions KSU Discounts Military Education Benefits Scholarships About About Us Blog Contact Instructor Application Give to CPE Login Login to Register Login to Moodle Search for: 50+ OLLI Home All courses 50+ OLLI Mah Jongg Mah Jongg Leisure $99 More Info & Contact Enroll Now Share: Overview Offerings & Schedules Instructor Financial Aid This tile game, similar to Gin Rummy or Dominoes, is an Asian favorite and an exciting alternative to card games. Learn the basic rules and play of the game. Enjoy a fun and challenging experience. No partner is needed. Hurry and register, the class is limited to 8 students. Mary Goscha After traveling to Asia often and seeing many men sitting on small barrels throwing tiles around, Martina was curious. She grew up playing games with her family and friends, so she investigated. It was Mah Jongg! Mah Jongg is played all over Asia. Everyone plays. The Chinese, Koreans, Japanese, etc. when she finally learned to play, she wanted everyone to play! Martina started teaching at Kennesaw in 1994. I had a career with Delta Air Lines and have traveled to just about every country in the world. Since retiring in 1999, I have been very active in the community with Leadership Cobb and Honorary Commanders. I have served on The boards of the Cobb/Douglas Red Cross, the Department of Family and Children’s Services, and recently 5 years on the Library Foundation. I have 2 Chinese crested powder puffs.(dogs) I am a lifetime Master Gardener. I attend Transfiguration Catholic Church where I serve as a Lecture and a Euchristic minister. I have a wonderful life and of course Mah Jongg is part of it! I try to play at least twice a week! If you want a challenge, come learn to play! #1: Mah Jongg Start/End: 10/04/2022 to 11/08/2022 Fee: $99 Delivery: Classroom Location: KSU Center Class ID 40308 Start Date October 04, 2022 End Date November 08, 2022 Delivery Classroom Location KSU Center Sessions 6 Weeks 6 Total Hours 12.0 CEUs 0.0 Classes Schedule: Session Date Time Location Delivery Instructor 01 Tuesday, 10/04/2022 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Mary Goscha 02 Tuesday, 10/11/2022 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Mary Goscha 03 Tuesday, 10/18/2022 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Mary Goscha 04 Tuesday, 10/25/2022 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Mary Goscha 05 Tuesday, 11/01/2022 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Mary Goscha 06 Tuesday, 11/08/2022 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Mary Goscha ENROLL IN THIS OFFERING Financial Aid Options No options available at this moment. title: The 1990s; The Last Hurrah of the 20th Century – Community and Professional Education
body: The 1990s; The Last Hurrah of the 20th Century – Community and Professional Education Courses Professional Certificates & Courses Corporate Learning Online Courses Executive Education 50+ OLLI Program Personal Enrichment Classes Summer Camps Intensive English Program Our Community Catalog Events Open House Webinars Graduation Book an Event Student Resources Career Development Resources Catalog Financial Aid Frequently Asked Questions KSU Discounts Military Education Benefits Scholarships About About Us Blog Contact Instructor Application Give to CPE Login Login to Register Login to Moodle Search for: Courses Professional Certificates & Courses Corporate Learning Online Courses Executive Education 50+ OLLI Program Personal Enrichment Classes Summer Camps Intensive English Program Our Community Catalog Events Open House Webinars Graduation Book an Event Student Resources Career Development Resources Catalog Financial Aid Frequently Asked Questions KSU Discounts Military Education Benefits Scholarships About About Us Blog Contact Instructor Application Give to CPE Login Login to Register Login to Moodle Search for: 50+ OLLI Home All courses 50+ OLLI The 1990s; The Last Hurrah of the 20th Century The 1990s; The Last Hurrah of the 20th Century History $69 More Info & Contact Enroll Now Share: Overview Offerings & Schedules Instructor Financial Aid The last decade of the 20th century sent a message that the future might not entirely be one of peace and prosperity. During that decade the world would experience two major political shifts, the collapse of the Soviet Union and the rise of the European Union. Germany was reunited and Nelson Mandela became the president of South Africa. There were advances in science and technology, the commercial internet and the iMac both debuted. It was also the decade of the O.J. Simpson trial, the death of Princess Diana and the Branch Davidian raid. In this class will look at these events and more, leading up to the dawn of the 21st century. Elsa Nystrom Professor of History emerita, at Kennesaw State University,PhD, Loyola University of Chicago. Specialist 19th and 20th century US and European history, Author of Mad for Speed, the Racing Life of Joan Newton Cuneo and Georgiarambler.com a travel and culture blog. #1: The 1990s; The Last Hurrah of the 20th Century Start/End: 10/05/2022 to 11/23/2022 Fee: $69 Delivery: Classroom Location: KSU Center Class ID 40383 Start Date October 05, 2022 End Date November 23, 2022 Delivery Classroom Location KSU Center Sessions 8 Weeks 8 Total Hours 12.0 CEUs 0.0 Classes Schedule: Session Date Time Location Delivery Instructor 01 Wednesday, 10/05/2022 02:00 PM - 03:30 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Elsa Nystrom 02 Wednesday, 10/12/2022 02:00 PM - 03:30 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Elsa Nystrom 03 Wednesday, 10/19/2022 02:00 PM - 03:30 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Elsa Nystrom 04 Wednesday, 10/26/2022 02:00 PM - 03:30 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Elsa Nystrom 05 Wednesday, 11/02/2022 02:00 PM - 03:30 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Elsa Nystrom 06 Wednesday, 11/09/2022 02:00 PM - 03:30 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Elsa Nystrom 07 Wednesday, 11/16/2022 02:00 PM - 03:30 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Elsa Nystrom 08 Wednesday, 11/23/2022 02:00 PM - 03:30 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Elsa Nystrom ENROLL IN THIS OFFERING Financial Aid Options No options available at this moment. We will practice the fundamentals of the language, reviewing basic vocabulary and expressions. Students will feel more confident when they will have to speak the language, each class will have a topic to talk about. Don’t be shy and jump into the conversation! Antonella Giannasca Antonella was born in Rome, Italy and moved to the United States 16 years ago. This is her 13th year teaching Italian. She often travels back to Italy to visit family. Antonella's favorite memory is a nice Italian cappuccino with her favorite "cornetto!" She recently completed a TESOL Certificate and looks forward to teaching English to native Italian speakers. #1: Intermediate Italian Conversation Start/End: 10/06/2022 to 11/10/2022 Fee: $89 Delivery: Classroom Location: KSU Center Class ID 40344 Start Date October 06, 2022 End Date November 10, 2022 Delivery Classroom Location KSU Center Sessions 6 Weeks 6 Total Hours 9.0 CEUs 0.0 Classes Schedule: Session Date Time Location Delivery Instructor 01 Thursday, 10/06/2022 12:00 PM - We cover all the following in this quick 3-hour class: Setup – connection to phone Review of controls within the phone for the watch Review of buttons/dials on watch Common uses – answer call, receive a text, ping my phone Fancier Features – Check my heart rate, emergency contacts Natalie Silver Originally from Dallas Texas, Natalie Silver moved to Atlanta after graduate school to begin her own training and consulting business. For over 20 years, Natalie has instructed people of all ages on all types of software. body: Who Really Won the West? – Community and Professional Education Courses Professional Certificates & Courses Corporate Learning Online Courses Executive Education 50+ OLLI Program Personal Enrichment Classes Summer Camps Intensive English Program Our Community Catalog Events Open House Webinars Graduation Book an Event Student Resources Career Development Resources Catalog Financial Aid Frequently Asked Questions KSU Discounts Military Education Benefits Scholarships About About Us Blog Contact Instructor Application Give to CPE Login Login to Register Login to Moodle Search for: Courses Professional Certificates & Courses Corporate Learning Online Courses Executive Education 50+ OLLI Program Personal Enrichment Classes Summer Camps Intensive English Program Our Community Catalog Events Open House Webinars Graduation Book an Event Student Resources Career Development Resources Catalog Financial Aid Frequently Asked Questions KSU Discounts Military Education Benefits Scholarships About About Us Blog Contact Instructor Application Give to CPE Login Login to Register Login to Moodle Search for: 50+ OLLI Home All courses 50+ OLLI Who Really Won the West? Who Really Won the West? History $69 More Info & Contact Enroll Now Share: Overview Offerings & Schedules Instructor Financial Aid The American Westward movement was the most monumental expansion in the history of the world. This class will explore the men and women who pioneered that movement. The personalities coupled with historic events make dramatic and inspiring stories that need to be told. Students will meet personalities like Lewis & Clark, Crockett, the builders to the transcontinental railroad, Fremont, Pike and Carson as well as those who drove the herds north. Quentin Thomas Quentin Thomas is a respected historian, author, and instructor. His passion is American history with an emphasis on the early Western United States. As a retired senior military officer he brings a unique historical perspective to palaces where he has often visited and studied in great detail. His classes have been enthusiastically attended by hundreds of students at numerous locations and events. #1: Who Really Won the West? Start/End: 09/21/2022 to 11/09/2022 Fee: $69 Delivery: Classroom Location: KSU Center Class ID 40380 Start Date September 21, 2022 End Date November 09, 2022 Delivery Classroom Location KSU Center Sessions 8 Weeks 8 Total Hours 8.0 CEUs 0.0 Classes Schedule: Session Date Time Location Delivery Instructor 01 Wednesday, 09/21/2022 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Quentin Thomas 02 Wednesday, 09/28/2022 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Quentin Thomas 03 Wednesday, 10/05/2022 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Quentin Thomas 04 Wednesday, 10/12/2022 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Quentin Thomas 05 Wednesday, 10/19/2022 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Quentin Thomas 06 Wednesday, 10/26/2022 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Quentin Thomas 07 Wednesday, 11/02/2022 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Quentin Thomas 08 Wednesday, 11/09/2022 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Quentin Thomas ENROLL IN THIS OFFERING Financial Aid Options No options available at this moment. title: Reduce Tax Liability in Retirement – Community and Professional Education
body: Reduce Tax Liability in Retirement – Community and Professional Education Courses Professional Certificates & Courses Corporate Learning Online Courses Executive Education 50+ OLLI Program Personal Enrichment Classes Summer Camps Intensive English Program Our Community Catalog Events Open House Webinars Graduation Book an Event Student Resources Career Development Resources Catalog Financial Aid Frequently Asked Questions KSU Discounts Military Education Benefits Scholarships About About Us Blog Contact Instructor Application Give to CPE Login Login to Register Login to Moodle Search for: Courses Professional Certificates & Courses Corporate Learning Online Courses Executive Education 50+ OLLI Program Personal Enrichment Classes Summer Camps Intensive English Program Our Community Catalog Events Open House Webinars Graduation Book an Event Student Resources Career Development Resources Catalog Financial Aid Frequently Asked Questions KSU Discounts Military Education Benefits Scholarships About About Us Blog Contact Instructor Application Give to CPE Login Login to Register Login to Moodle Search for: 50+ OLLI Home All courses 50+ OLLI Reduce Tax Liability in Retirement Reduce Tax Liability in Retirement Personal Finance $49 More Info & Contact Enroll Now Share: Overview Offerings & Schedules Instructor Financial Aid How to Reduce or Eliminate Taxes on RMD’S How to pay little to NO Taxes on a Roth Conversion Tax-Free Income Ideas and Concepts BONUS: New IRA Distribution Rules New IRA Inheritance Rules Nicholas Yeomans Nic Yeomans is the President and Chief Compliance Officer at Yeomans Consulting Group, Inc. In his 16th year of practice, Nic is a Certified Financial Planner where he primarily focuses on advanced tax and estate planning for business owners, medical professionals, and retirees. Nic has a passion to educate his clients and peers, often teaching classes and hosting Q&A sessions. Nic graduated from Lee University and continued his education at Emory University where he graduated from The Learning Institute for Financial Executives and received his Certificate in Financial Planning. He is also a member of the International Association of Registered Financial Consultants. Outside of work, Nic has been married to his college sweetheart Suzette for 15 years; together they have 3 daughters and 2 dogs. They are active members at North Metro Church in Marietta, and in their free time, they enjoy traveling and discovering new restaurants. A few times a month you will find Nic on the golf course or hosting a guy's night to watch UFC fights. #1: Reduce Tax Liability in Retirement Start/End: 09/20/2022 to 09/20/2022 Fee: $49 Delivery: Classroom Location: KSU Center Class ID 39861 Start Date September 20, 2022 End Date September 20, 2022 Delivery Classroom Location KSU Center Sessions 1 Weeks 1 Total Hours 2.5 CEUs 0.0 Classes Schedule: Session Date Time Location Delivery Instructor 01 Tuesday, 09/20/2022 09:30 AM - 12:00 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Nicholas Yeomans ENROLL IN THIS OFFERING #2: Reduce Tax Liability in Retirement Online Live Start/End: 09/20/2022 to 09/20/2022 Fee: $49 Delivery: Online Location: n/a Class ID 39862 Start Date September 20, 2022 End Date September 20, 2022 Delivery Online Location n/a Total Hours 2.5 CEUs 0.0 Classes Schedule: Session Date Time Location Delivery Instructor 01 Tuesday, 09/20/2022 09:30 AM - 12:00 PM n/a Online Nicholas Yeomans ENROLL IN THIS OFFERING Financial Aid Options No options available at this moment. title: The Vietnam War Part II 1962-1969 – Community and Professional Education
body: The Vietnam War Part II 1962-1969 – Community and Professional Education Courses Professional Certificates & Courses Corporate Learning Online Courses Executive Education 50+ OLLI Program Personal Enrichment Classes Summer Camps Intensive English Program Our Community Catalog Events Open House Webinars Graduation Book an Event Student Resources Career Development Resources Catalog Financial Aid Frequently Asked Questions KSU Discounts Military Education Benefits Scholarships About About Us Blog Contact Instructor Application Give to CPE Login Login to Register Login to Moodle Search for: Courses Professional Certificates & Courses Corporate Learning Online Courses Executive Education 50+ OLLI Program Personal Enrichment Classes Summer Camps Intensive English Program Our Community Catalog Events Open House Webinars Graduation Book an Event Student Resources Career Development Resources Catalog Financial Aid Frequently Asked Questions KSU Discounts Military Education Benefits Scholarships About About Us Blog Contact Instructor Application Give to CPE Login Login to Register Login to Moodle Search for: 50+ OLLI Home All courses 50+ OLLI The Vietnam War Part II 1962-1969 The Vietnam War Part II 1962-1969 History $99 More Info & Contact Enroll Now Share: Overview Offerings & Schedules Instructor Financial Aid AMERICA TAKES OVER – From the advisory effort to landing of the Marines, Buildup and Escalation, The War Turns North, Khe Sanh Base & Siege, Lang Vei is Overrun, Tet 1968, Bombing Halts, Peace Negotiations, Passing the Torch… Gerald Flinchum 1970-1988 U.S. Army veteran, service to include; Vietnam, Georgia National Guard, U.S. Army Reserves, Commissioned officer Georgia State Defense Force. Retired telecommunications & networking fields, since 2002, over 30 years work-service. Married 26 years, 2 children. Author of 8 historical softbound books, local history, family history & articles for N.C. County Heritage series. Over 10 lectures since 2014 on local Civil War history; county historical societies, libraries, Woodstock Welcome Center & various veteran groups. Current Projects: The Civil War in Pickens County, Vietnam Veteran project & Guerrilla War in Georgia. #1: The Vietnam War Part II 1962-1969 Start/End: 10/04/2022 to 11/22/2022 Fee: $99 Delivery: Classroom Location: KSU Center Class ID 40382 Start Date October 04, 2022 End Date November 22, 2022 Delivery Classroom Location KSU Center Sessions 8 Weeks 8 Total Hours 12.0 CEUs 0.0 Classes Schedule: Session Date Time Location Delivery Instructor 01 Tuesday, 10/04/2022 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Gerald Flinchum 02 Tuesday, 10/11/2022 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Gerald Flinchum 03 Tuesday, 10/18/2022 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Gerald Flinchum 04 Tuesday, 10/25/2022 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Gerald Flinchum 05 Tuesday, 11/01/2022 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Gerald Flinchum 06 Tuesday, 11/08/2022 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Gerald Flinchum 07 Tuesday, 11/15/2022 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Gerald Flinchum 08 Tuesday, 11/22/2022 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM KSU Center ClassRoom Gerald Flinchum ENROLL IN THIS OFFERING Financial Aid Options No options available at this moment. Although Tai Chi movements and postures will be emphasized, we will also learn how Tai Chi principles can reduce stress, improve your health and give you a new body with a new outlook. Tai Chi style meditation and relaxation skills will be taught as well as some easy-to-follow self-defense techniques. This class is for anyone, regardless of physical condition. This is an opportunity to exercise the mind, body and spirit by means of the ancient art of Tai Chi. Yang Tai Chi will be taught. No instructor information available at this time. body: Other Uses - Visual Identity Program | KSU Oops! You don't have Javascript enabled. Some features on this site might not work correctly. Kennesaw State University Visual Identity Program Apply Visit Give Calendar Resources For Current Students Online Only Students Faculty & Staff Parents & Family Alumni & Friends Community & Business MENU About KSU Academics Admissions Student Life Research Alumni Athletics Home Using This Guide Using This Guide About Our Name Terminology Official Logo Guidelines Official Logo Guidelines Logo Usage VIP Logos, Marks and Seal Official Primary Colors Typography Unacceptable Variations Stationery Logo Request Email Signature Athletics Style Guide Facilities Branding Guide Other Uses Other Uses Signage Environmental Design Website Design Design Approval Advertising Approval Form Licensing Downloads Office of Strategic Communications and Marketing Search KSU KSU Style Guide / uses Home Using This Guide Using This Guide About Our Name Terminology Official Logo Guidelines Official Logo Guidelines Logo Usage VIP Logos, Marks and Seal Official Primary Colors Typography Unacceptable Variations Stationery Logo Request Email Signature Athletics Style Guide Facilities Branding Guide Other Uses Other Uses Signage Environmental Design Website Design Design Approval Advertising Approval Form Licensing Downloads Office of Strategic Communications and Marketing Other Uses It is important that Kennesaw State University project an image of excellence and cohesiveness to all of our audiences. This guide establishes consistent visual usage of the official Kennesaw State University logo. The logo and official university names have registered trademark protection, and any use of the logo or official university names other than those identified in this guide is prohibited. The Kennesaw State University visual identity programs establishes official policy and standards for the design of Kennesaw State publications, stationery, signage and other applications, including the Web. This KSU visual identity style guide outlines specific rules and standards to be followed by authors and editors. Adhering to these standards will help ensure that communications from every college, department and office speak with a clear and uniform voice that best represents the image and brand of Kennesaw State University. The proper use of the KSU official logos and university name must be used consistently across campus including signage, presentation and electronic media. This section outlines guidelines for logo usage in the following areas: signage, environmental design, Web design, and video. Questions concerning usage of this guide should be directed to Office of Strategic Communications and Marketing at 470-578-6203. title: KSU Web Content Style Guide
body: KSU Web Content Style Guide Oops! You don't have Javascript enabled. Some features on this site might not work correctly. Kennesaw State University KSU Web Content Style Guide Apply Visit Give Calendar Resources For Current Students Online Only Students Faculty & Staff Parents & Family Alumni & Friends Community & Business MENU About KSU Academics Admissions Student Life Research Alumni Athletics Home Visual Elements Explanation of Color and Uses Typography Images and Photography Snippets and Icons Required Elements Template Navigation Naming Conventions Writing for the Web Guidelines for Content Development Dates and Numbers Punctuation Usage Abbreviations and Acronyms Alphabetical Entries Accessibility About Modern Campus Omni CMS Search KSU KSU Web Content Style Guide Home Visual Elements Explanation of Color and Uses Typography Images and Photography Snippets and Icons Required Elements Template Navigation Naming Conventions Writing for the Web Guidelines for Content Development Dates and Numbers Punctuation Usage Abbreviations and Acronyms Alphabetical Entries Accessibility About Modern Campus Omni CMS Purpose The purpose of this Web content style guide is to clarify the design and management of Kennesaw State University’s (KSU) Web pages, thereby contributing to the uniformity and professionalism of KSU’s Web presence. It is presented as a reference to ensure attention to the following key objectives of all KSU Web pages: Established Identity: Immediately recognizable University branding must be present to confirm affiliation with KSU. Consistency: Because of the vast number of KSU departments, schools, and programs, uniformity between Web pages is vital to achieve the goal of presenting a cohesive University Website. Accuracy: Pages should be free from error and display up-to-date information. Usability: Navigation of sites must be efficient, intuitive, and clear, making information easily understood for the widest possible audience. Audience This Web content style guide is intended for use by all KSU faculty and staff tasked with designing, developing, and/or managing a Web page within the KSU Website. Scope Any official University Web page that represents Kennesaw State University, its programs, departments, or schools should adhere to the guidelines detailed in this Web content style guide. Despite their affiliation with KSU, student organizations and/or groups fall outside the scope of this Web content style guide. Contents Within the KSU Web content style guide, Web authors will find: An explanation and guide to visual elements, including colors, typography, images/photography, and icons An overview of the snippets and icons, including their corresponding elements, available for use in page development A description of required elements (i.e. template, navigation, and naming conventions) Reference material regarding writing for the Web, including best practices, usage guidelines, and treatment of frequently-used terms Accessibility requirements A general introduction to Modern Campus Omni CMS and the ways in which the program is utilized Contact Info Kennesaw Campus 1000 Chastain Road Kennesaw, GA 30144 Marietta Campus 1100 South Marietta Pkwy Marietta, GA 30060 Campus Maps Phone 470-KSU-INFO (470-578-4636) kennesaw.edu/info Media Resources Resources For Current Students Online Only Students Faculty & Staff Parents & Family Alumni & Friends Community & Business Related Links Libraries Housing Financial Aid Degrees, Majors & Programs Registrar Job Opportunities Campus Security Global Education Diverse & Inclusive Excellence Sustainability Accessibility Follow KSU 470-KSU-INFO (470-578-4636) © 2022 Kennesaw State University.
